thread.title: Nicole Scherzinger flashes sideboob at BRITs after party

author: Rebecca Davison for MailOnline
title: Nicole Scherzinger flashes sideboob at BRITs after party

persons.name: anohni ellie goulding lianne la havas nao
bon iver bruno mars leonard cohen
sean paul - hair tinie tempah ft zara larsson
craig david kano michael kiwanuka skepta

organizations.name: clean bandit ft sean paul & anne-marie - rockabye coldplay
manor michael kiwanuka - love & hate skepta konnichiwa

text:
She wore nothing but a suit jacket and matching thigh-high boots to the BRITs earlier in the evening, but Nicole Scherzinger seriously ramped up the sex appeal later that night.
The 38-year-old headed to the Universal after party hosted by Soho House and Bacardi Rum at 180 The Strand on Wednesday night wearing a very sexy silver crochet dress.
Flashing a hint of sideboob under the knockout creation, Nicole went underwear free as she posed for a series of snaps for the daring look.
That's some heavy metal: Nicole Scherzinger flashed her sideboob as she went underwear free in a sexy semi-sheer crochet dress at the Universal BRITs after party at 180 The Strand on Wednesday night
A step back in time: Still sporting her 80s inspired crimped hair from earlier, the stunner completed her look with a pair of perspex heels
Still sporting her 80s inspired crimped hair from earlier, the stunner completed her look with a pair of perspex heels.
The star-studded party boasted Katy Perry, Ashley James, Mollie King and Jedward, not to mention Ellie Goulding and Pixie Lott.
But Nicole chose musician Naughty Boy to pose with for a snap.
I Don't Need A Mane! Earlier, Nicole opted for a radical image overhaul at the 37th BRIT Awards ceremony on Wednesday as she stormed the red carpet with a dramatic crimped 'do
He's just a rascal: chose musician Naughty Boy to pose with for a snap
Meanwhile, Nicole opted for a radical image overhaul at the 37th annual BRIT Awards ceremony on Wednesday as she stormed the red carpet with a dramatic crimped hairstyle.
Posing up a storm as she headed into London 's O2 Arena, the former Pussycat Doll was a vision on the night.
Flaunting her cleavage, the Don't Cha hitmaker donned a plunging scarlet dress designed to look like a blazer.
The tweed design was interspersed with flecks of gold which flattered her tanned complexion and ensured she would turn heads on the night.
She teamed the garment with thigh high boots in the same eye-catching pattern whilst she crimped her raven tresses and styled them in a dramatic bouffant.
Turning heads: Posing up a storm as she headed into London's O2 Arena, the Pussycat Doll, 38, was a vision on the night
Suited and booted: Flaunting her cleavage, the Don't Cha hitmaker donned a plunging scarlet dress designed to look like a blazer
The BRITs features a star-studded line-up with Katy Perry, Ed Sheeran, Robbie Williams, Little Mix, Bruno Mars, The 1975, Emeli Sandé and Skepta all taking the stage.
Emma Willis and Dermot O'Leary present the show after being drafted in when Michael Buble was forced to pull out due to his son's battle with cancer.
'The BRITs is an iconic show that I've watched and attended many times,' said Dermot about his hosting duties.'
Scarlet siren: The tweed design was interspersed with flecks of gold which flattered her tanned complexion and ensured she would turn heads on the night
Radiant: Nicole crimped her raven tresses and styled them in a dramatic bouffant whilst her hazel coloured peepers were framed with a sweep of golden eye shadow
The thigh's the limit! Nicole teamed her scarlet blazer-style dress with thigh high boots in the same eye-catching pattern which revealed a hint of her tanned and toned thighs
He continued: 'It's a holy grail for a broadcaster, and I'm really looking forward to working with Emma, who I'm a big fan of, and celebrating a brilliant year of British music.'
'To present the BRITs is an honour but to be doing it alongside one of my absolute favourites, Mr Dermot O'Leary is just bonkers. Bring on the BRITs 2017,' added Emma.
Little Mix and Grime artist Skepta lead the nominations pack with three apiece - with many critics wondering if the North London-born MC can replicate his prestigious Mercury Music Prize win and scoop the British Album of The Year prize for Konnichiwa.
